website_summaries.verdict: With its improved battery life, the slightly evolved Jabra Sport Elite Upgraded remains one of the stronger early entries in the totally wireless headphone arena.
pros: The Jabra Elite Sport Upgraded is a set of totally fully waterproof wireless sports earphones with a built-in heart-rate monitor that sounds quite good
Battery life is 4.5 hours, and the case delivers two more charges of equal length
Works very well as a headset as single or stereo buds
Compatible with leading third-party fitness apps as well as Jabra's companion fitness app
cons: May be a tad bulky for some people's ears
you lose some bass (and sound quality in general) if you don't get a tight seal

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, battery and connection, BUT can't say the same for durability or reliability in terms of life expectancy.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is solid, it's probably the only worth while truly wireless ear buds in the market. Unfortunately, the left bud stopped working after 3 months (Received 28th of Sep 2017) of use. I didn't even use it in water or do anything that could cause it to break, it just stopped midway when i was listening to a song at work. Tried resetting, updating, reconnecting etc with no luck. They would have been perfect, if only they were reliable, i'm not the only one with a non-working bud.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: They worked great for a month
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM JABRA. They worked great for a month, then the right earbud dropped in volume to about 25%. Spent one month going back and forth with Jabra support only to be told that we will not replace the brand new earbuds I purchased because I bought them from a reseller on Amazon. This is the worst customer service I've seen, and as far as I'm concerned Jabra stole from me. Bose from now on. At least they support their customers and stand by their products.
customer_reviews.author: Area Man Billy

customer_reviews.title: Im not happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a year ago as a birthday present for myself, 8 weeks later they started having issues with the sound shifting off center and focusing more to the left ear. I contacted Jabra and about 3 hours of my time and 3 weeks later they sent me a new left earbud and everything was great. Today this same issue is happening again. This product should last longer than 10 months. I'm really disappointed with this company they should know better, I is their job to know better.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent workout buds and great feedback
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a pair of earbuds that stay in place while working out.The 3 tips with 3 wing combination allowed for a very good fit.I do have to push in for heart rate monitors about 2 times in 45 minutes of running but they aren't falling out.You get get feedback on your workouts ,similar to The Polar Watch but with the added ability to listen to music. The music is good but not great ,the max volume is loud but is isn't overly loud so some people might want more. The app works well but needs a couple of other machines, like elliptical and stair stepper. I like the voice coach as well.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Von Maryland

customer_reviews.title: OK earbuds...
customer_reviews.text: These are good earbuds, but are missing a feature which is available on Airpods and a couple of much lower priced buds available. The feature I find very important in an earbud is the ability to use either one independently of the other. With these, you cannot use the left one without the right one. I find it inconvenient because I like to use the right one until it runs out of power then put it in the case for charging and using the left one. These earbuds do not let you do this because the left one is useless when the right one is in the charging case.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Schnoor

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose or any top headsets outhere
customer_reviews.text: I cant get enough of these headsets. They sound amazing, track my movement, track my heartbeat, track my workouts...these headsets do it all. They say they are waterproof, cant confirm or deny as I do not place any of my electronics in a compromising situation. They are sweat proof as I do workout in them and the noise cancelling feature is pretty awesome. It seems as that it has a noise enhancement feature that allows you to hear everything in your surroundings which is pretty nice so you don't have to take your headsets off. It comes with all different sizes of mushroom earbuds and fitment enhancers.
customer_reviews.author: Archangel

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like these, but two significant issues
customer_reviews.text: The actual function of these is fantastic; never have problems with the bluetooth dropping, a reasonably nice clear sound (for an audiophile), and no issues with subjecting these to hours of sweat. The problem really, is the form, and I went back to the original Bose SoundSports (Wireless, but wired between the buds). What were the form issues for me? (1) Never were truly a "comfortable" fit in the ear - tolerable - but would noticeably lose their comfort after an hour, at which point it would bother me to have them in. Tried all 6 combinations of sizing/build. (2) Using the buttons on the ear buds, if you have your phone inaccessible, is borderline painful.
customer_reviews.author: Parsec Trading

customer_reviews.title: These honestly might be the best headphones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: These honestly might be the best headphones I've ever had. I've used them heavily for six months and they've yet to disappoint. They sound fantastic, they pair easily, and the recharging case is a huge plus. Previously, I had Bose Sound Sports which just wouldn't stay in my ear. I will note, the fins that came with them made it tough to get a good fit. I ended up shortening the medium incrementally with a lighter. I kept trying it out until the fit was right. Now it fits in my ear like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Suspicious about this product
customer_reviews.text: I loved that they are not as bulky as my previous earphones from Bose (Soundsport). They sound okay BUT, I'm starting to have problems with the sound coordination between the left and right. For about the first five minutes of playing something, the right side sounds very low and with distortion. After a little while, the sound is back to the same level as the left. Lately, I've been noticing that the right side is not recovering. Sometimes, it looks like putting them back in the charger for a little bit seems to solve the problem but I am suspicious of this. For a product of this price, there shouldn't be any problem with synchronization of audio and Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: I only use this for workout 1 hr per day ...
customer_reviews.text: I only use this for workout 1 hr per day. After 3 months the EarWings already stretched and need to be replaced. I contacted jabra support but all they replied with was with a 20% discount. Having to replace EarWings every 3 month is un acceptable. This is a serious design flaw. You cannot just purchase earwins you must purchase entire Jabra Elite Sport Accessory Pack ! $19.99 . This would get very expensive to do every 2-3 months !!!!! i would recommend you purchase Bose
customer_reviews.author: Taminator

customer_reviews.title: Lag and sync issues with earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds don't activate right away when sound is playing, there's a noticeable delay of up to two seconds before they activate - and once activated there's another 1-2 second delay before the left earbud kicks in. Contacting Jabra support was useless. They advised that the buds should be unpaired, language changed, and then repaired. When this didn't work they simply ignored all further correspondence including attempts to open a new ticket with support. They charge premium prices for products that should be found in the bargain bin.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Valenziano

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and horrible sounding for the price
customer_reviews.text: Other then what the headline states the included silicone/rubber earbuds are cheap, see what happened to mine when I tried to switch it to another earbud. This was the second chance I gave this brand and my last. But really, the horrendous sound and the fact my ears hurt after one easy workout killed it for me. I also noticed a static on my left earbud :( Get the Boss SoundSport, they are on sale until the end of year, even though they are goofy looking they sound the best and fit comfy... and the buds are magnetically secured to the case unlike the Jabra's. I wouldn't buy these at $49.99, not worth it. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: mainca

customer_reviews.title: The Best Ever BT Headset w/ a HR sensor, even after several years.
customer_reviews.text: These BT Earbuds may be a few years old, but I have not found any superior true wireless headsets with a heartrate sensor. This sensor is far more accurate than those found on smart watches and more reliable than chest sensors without sacraficing quality. Just keep two things in mind: Only the right Earbud has the fitness sensors, which is very reasonable. Less reasonable is the fact that the left earbud cannot work at all when used alone. Still,I would love to see an updated version which takes advantage of advances that haven taken place since this headset’s release
customer_reviews.author: The Real Zam

customer_reviews.title: Best bluetooth earbuds I have owned for working out and running.
customer_reviews.text: Best bluetooth earbuds I have owned for working out and running. I have gone through a quite a few bluetooth earbuds for working out. These are by far the best. No cables to get snagged on your neck while working out. I used them on a 3 mile run the other day and they stayed securely in my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Arjan

customer_reviews.title: Great lil headphones
customer_reviews.text: I only use these at the gym so nothing else they mentioned I use other than the blue tooth connection to my phone to listen to music while doing my cardio. I like that they stay charged up pretty good. I keep them in there charging case all the time but only plug them in to charge about ever other week. great sound and once I got the right little rubber plugs that fit my ears on them they have worked perfect since new.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Rains

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Super late review but i have had a healthy time to really get to know these ear buds. First off, this product was way overpriced for what you get. Right off the bat none of the sizes of ear moldings would fit very well in my ear. The battery life is dismal, it gives you a 3 or 4 warnings when they are about to die, no battery level moniter. The case and the earbuds together charge pretty slowly. The voice that lets you know whats going on (ie. Needs charging or connecting to phone) speaks broken english. This product is weird and i wish that i never wasted my money on it
customer_reviews.author: Lea R Nishimura

customer_reviews.title: So far, OK.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it offers a 3 year warranty against sweat. However, in order to activate the warranty, it says you need to register via the Jabra Sport Life app. No where on the app is there a link to register, as far as my knowledge. I can't find it. I can register online, but even there it says you must register via the APP in order to activate the 3 year warranty against sweat. Now, after reading the bad reviews and how Jabra does not honor the warranty when you need it, I'm considering returning this item. I already gave up on Samsung. Why can't any manufacturer make a reliable bluetooth earbud?
customer_reviews.author: Bil Yoelin

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth earphones
customer_reviews.text: Great bluetooth earphones, far better than Bose Soundsport wireless/wirefree. Stays inside ear with the right eartips, 6 pairs of eartips provided. Earphones doesn't show out of ears like the Bose earphones,that what I liked a lot. Battery charging case is what made me to give it 5 star on Battery life, otherwise would have given 4 star. Very compact charging case, easy portable. Sound clarity is awesome, noise cancellation is great. No sound lag. Worth the every bucks spent on this earphone. Initially ear might hurt, which indicates need to change to correct eartips. After changing the eartips, it was comfortable. Control buttons are bit small but operable. Only cons - Jabra should have provided a charging adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Kaumya

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and fiddly
customer_reviews.text: They definitely aren't comfortable. I spent ages making the fit the least unbearable that I could, and I've been tolerating them for the last two years, because of the heart rate tracking, but I've had enough. After each firmware update, it takes a good twenty minutes of fiddling around, tight at the start of a workout, before heart rate monitoring will reconnect with runkeeper. Today I've given up after a half hour. I'm done with these buds. Sound is decent and they block out noise very well. The audio pass through is bad, it pumps out static and wind very well. Find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Ebers

customer_reviews.title: They are (inexpensive) true wireless earbuds with a seemingly no good heart rate monitor...
customer_reviews.text: They frequently disconnect from my device, they sound ok, fit ok, and the app is terrible(navagation, and first time use). The heart rate sensor in mine also seems very innacurate, (resting heart rate for mine is 20 above what it should read) and the earbuds take a good 3 minutes to read my heart rate in the first place ...
customer_reviews.author: Joshua James Feenstra

customer_reviews.title: Failing Quality and Negligent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: After buying it 6 months ago, left earbud has started to intermittently stop working after only light usage. Was not even subjected to sports-like conditions. Contacted support and the minimum communication turnaround is greater than 7 days for each communication. Last communication from them was 11 days when I submitted a warranty request, at the guidance of customer service. Have not heard back from them since about what the next steps are or a response back from customer service when I emailed them back. Will definitely avoid buying from Jabra. This purchase was a complete waste of money and time. Would recommend avoiding at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Onoda

customer_reviews.title: Bad warranty experience
customer_reviews.text: I spent an hour sitting on hold with tech support today trying to get a status on my warranty case for my second pair earbuds. I have also sent several emails and tried posting to their Facebook page and their automated attendant at Facebook. At this point, I am a couple hundred dollars and Don't even have the broken earbuds. It's not looking good for Jabra. I will make sure the organizations I consult for know not to purchase any more conference room equipment from Jabra either. At this point the only thing I want is a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Grissom

customer_reviews.title: Fragile product and Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these daily for 4 months. I typically wear them for indoor use. I tried working out with them but found they wouldn’t stay in my ears when running. What’s worse is that after about 3 months the left earbud stopped working and the right earbud became muffled and the audio sounded as though it was coming through a torn speaker. I tried following jabra customer support guidance to clean the earbuds and reinstall then firmware, but nothing would restore audio to the left earbud or improve audio quality. I’m seriously disappointed and won’t be buying anything from Jabra again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lanphear

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit in my ears
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these headphones because I have the Elite Active 65T but wish they had a tab to hook into the ridge of my ear. These LOOKED like they would work, but the buds are just too big and I can’t get any of the hooks to properly engage. I don’t have huge ears, but I also don’t think I have tiny ears because I tend to use the largest ear gels and the largest wings/hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the diversity of options
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could wear these all day at my job. Very pleased with the diversity of options, heartbeat sensor, waterproof, software, foam tips, tracking and sound quality. This is a better quality product than AirPods! One improvement would be to add more microphones and increase the microphones quality to capture outside sounds better with the “hear through” feature. Can mostly just hear highpitched noises with the current 4 mics.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Great......until they break. Had for 3 months and right ear stopped working. Called Jabra and they sent me a replacement. 4 months after that the right ear stopes working. Called Jabra and was told I didn’t buy the extended warranty. Don’t bother waisting your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I forgot that I still have them
customer_reviews.text: So sad. When I bought those headphones, I was so excited, but very soon, I realize that the quality of sound was terrible. So I start to use them for podcasts... well if you have a little noise around forget about the sound is very low. Another big problem was the microphone, impossible to use these headphones to speak in the street. Impossible. After 1 year of use, one of the sides stops working correctly. So I stop using them. To be fair, never had an issue with the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: A Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have tiny ears and with the different adaptors I found the perfect fit. I have different adaptors for each ear. Sound awesome, block out other sounds (which can be scary if using these for running because you can't hear cars), connect to the app and detect heartbeat which is neat, and keep a charge (and the container they come in hold a charge too). Well worth the purchase. I love that the app also tells you the last known location of them in case you can't find where you left them!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Fish

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought these earbuds in June. Loved them. Just started having issues with the right earbud. Did all the resets . . . no improvement. Customer service is nonexistent. I email them and then don't hear back for days. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Grimsted

customer_reviews.title: Fitting is paramount.
customer_reviews.text: After almost a month ,2 updates to app.Another for the Bluetooth on my device I've somewhat changed my rating.The audio on these is probably the best I've heard from Any type of headphones.The fitting of them is extremely critical to the total functioning of these.You have to play with the gels ,pads until you find the perfect fit.Then Kik it and enjoy the best sounding buds in the world.
customer_reviews.author: mark arrington

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Sound and Fit
customer_reviews.text: These promised to be so good but don't fit, very uncomfortable with any combination of provided ear fins and gel or foam tips. Sound is ridiculously pitiful, there is distortion and the 'equalizer' function in the app does not improve usability. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Justin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Charging case no longer working after only 5 months in use.
customer_reviews.text: I need urgent assistance from manufacturer. Charging case no longer working after only 5 months in operation...Close examination of charging case revealed that one of the internal/charging pins no longer in place. This is very upsetting as to how cheaply this product is made in order for pin to just disappear.
customer_reviews.author: Sabino D.

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for better with the ambient noise to use while at work, but it was not great. I returned them and will be saving my money for better products I hope to see I’m the near future the more that this type of technology advances. The sound by its self is good. 🙃
customer_reviews.author: Krystyl Martinez

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FIT WIRELESS HEADPHONES!
customer_reviews.text: OK. This Product preforms has advertised! How, if any the FIT it everything ! After 30 days of daily use, I finally purchased the COMPLY Brand ear Tips designed for my Jabra Elite Sport wireless earphones. Additional $20.00. But, finally this product has achieved my 5 Stars ! I sweat more than most people during my 10K runs and 20 to 25 miles bikes and this product stays in my ear without any adjustments. But WORKS BEST WITH THE COMPLY BRAND tips. I only wish Jabra would have included the COMPLY BRAND PRODUCT just as their competitors have in this product category!
customer_reviews.author: NYCABI

customer_reviews.title: Left side inconsistently works. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these Headphones. The left ear kept going out or just producing static quality sound. It made it really annoying at the gym to keep messing with it. Don't waste your money on these headsets. Until Jabra figures out a true wireless sport headset look somewhere else. I wish I could return these but i am just outside the warranty 😩
customer_reviews.author: Kaydee

customer_reviews.title: I've taken business calls on them and everyone can hear me just fine. Love the travel case which is also a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY concerned about purchasing these given the price. But the truly wireless headphones appeal to me immensely. I found the right fit and they truly stay in my ear, even after vigorous workouts! Also, I've taken business calls on them and everyone can hear me just fine. Love the travel case which is also a charging station. Oh, and when you're working out it detects your heart rate. All around wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but expected more for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Like the sound quality, really clear. Charger fast. Didn’t like volume and noise cancellation. Thought the volume didn’t get high enough to cancel the outside noises. Also the control buttons, you have to press kind of hard and can hurt ones ears.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing headphones! Sound is great
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing headphones! Sound is great, and the fit is perfect. Take the time to find the right fit, and you'll fall in love with these headphones!! I love how they can track my progress as I work out. These are simply incredible headphones!!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: 1, Sound quality is not as good as I expected. Not very clear and you cannot notice the details. 2, Sweat can come into the ear through the buds when running, which makes you feel very uncomfortable. 3, The left bud can easily get disconnected from the right one from time to time. 4, For a 4.5 hours version, it can only last less than 4.
customer_reviews.author: Stone

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but pricey
customer_reviews.text: I guess for the price, I was expecting the world. But they do function really well, withstand running and other sudden movements while staying snugly in place. I have heard from others that sound quality on phone calls is outstanding. I'm not convinced I couldn't have gotten a equivalent ear bud for a much lower price, though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: Literally painful interface: the buttons are so stiff you have ...
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable. Inconsistent sound quality. Literally painful interface: the buttons are so stiff you have to jam the thing into your ear to use them. The app requires some service to be running, but doesn't explain why or what it does.
customer_reviews.author: Cory O

customer_reviews.title: You *must* achieve the right fit.
customer_reviews.text: Great functionality, very good sound, perfect for working out. Tip: Get the fit right for good sound. Tip: Correct placement might not be obvious (at least one youtube review showed the reviewer wearing them wrong) Tip: Your ears are probably not symmetric. Perhaps you (like me) will need a different gel/foam piece for each ear. Tip: Do not just place them anywhere, they are very small and easily lost. I got my left earbud run over by cars within two weeks :-(
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, still going!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in Nov 2017 and I still use them today. Looks like there are newer versions on the market with better battery, so that is probably the way to go, but in terms of quality, battery, connecting to my devices (both iOS and Android), for 2017 when I bought them, these were great. Having the case that charges it makes a big difference, so battery isn't as much of an issue as it could be. I like the way these fit in my ears personally, but everyone seems to be different in what they like for their ears.
customer_reviews.author: KeithBourne

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer I’ve only been using my headphones for about a week now so I can’t comment on the longevity of the quality. With that being said these are great! I was worried about the sound quality with a lot of negative reviews commenting on the lack of bass. You really do have to play around with the different size earpieces that come within the box. Turns out I have some big ass ears🤷‍♂️. Sound quality is great 👍 once you find what fits you. The fitness app that comes with it is a great plus, I just wish the workout routines had more choices to accurately count calories.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: for 220 bucks everything should work.
customer_reviews.text: The most important button doesn't work. The ON/OFF/Pause/take call button doesn't do anything. 1 click, 1 sec hold, 3 sec hold, 5 sec hold, 10 sec hold, 20 sec hold. All on the same button does nothing. pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: renzo gamarra

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but for the sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, great connection, great functionality. I am pulling a few stars because I think they are lacking on the base. Having done my research I was willing to take that trade because I read about too many connectivity issues with Bose equavalent product. So tried them for a day and then could not get past it. I am not a hi-fi sound geek by any means, but this sound is just not the quality I would expect for the price of the product. Sorry, had to return them and will be going back to Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY IT - DOESN’T LAST LONG
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it worked... Got it on July/2018 and started using on August/2018. Treated them as my jewels... On November 7th right earbud suddenly stopped working. Got in touch with jabra’s customer support and after some days of anxious awaiting, they told it’s should be replaced. But I live in Brazil, bought it from amazon and can’t send it back to usa, so there’s nothing I can do about it.. Just wished they could send me a new one... because an expensive gadget shouldn’t last so little... and there’s LOTS of complaints just like mine...
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love these, they are pretty comfortable (takes some getting used to but I can now have them in for hours with no issue). The sounds pass through is excellent to hear cars on walks so people don't sneak up behind you at the gym. Sound quality is excellent, especially when having phone conversations. Connects quickly and the battery life is excellent. They are pricey, but definitely worth the money. Only thing I would ask they improve on is the find my head phones function.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied!!
customer_reviews.text: They kept falling out of my ears even with trying the different pieces that came in the box. I ended up returning them. Very dissatisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Mother’s Day present
customer_reviews.text: Gave to wife as a present for mother’s day. Works great, music and fitness app all in one. Just needed to get use to and proper earwig fit. Loves the app and seeing calories reading after workout. No issues coming out during jogging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun to track my run
customer_reviews.text: They can hurt your ears a little till you get used to them. But the ability to track your pace, location, elevation change and heartbeat all in one app is a great tool to help dial in your run. The sound is great and they stay in place. Usually, don't lose heartbeat, but I can't say never happens.
customer_reviews.author: matthew p.

customer_reviews.title: Only connects to one device at a time
customer_reviews.text: Tricky to get setup, but once you do, they are amazing. Sound quality is great, calls sound better through the earbuds than through the phone, background noise cancellation - or not - option is my favorite thing. Major downfall is they can only connect to one device at a time so they can’t be connected to your phone AND watch. Just one of the other.
customer_reviews.author: Meg.

customer_reviews.title: Consistently loses noise balance.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable sports buds that can handle tons of sweat. Great battery life as well, coupled with a very f fast charging case. Unfortunately, it's completely ruined by how often sound balance is completely thrown off. Sound will shift from one ear bud to the other whenever volume is adjusted. Cannot recommend these wireless buds. I want to enjoy them but that's just not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Robotlost

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: I loved them when I first purchased them. After wearing one for walking and listening to podcasts. The right one won’t charge fully.cant use only the left one for 200.00 they should last more than one year.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Great work out headphones
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these after my first 10 workouts. I also use it for conference calls for work. I also like the app it comes with. It is a good design overall. It is able to detect heart rate in ~15 seconds and record it during the workout. Area for improvement is, inter working of the app with iOS. My iPhone does not detect it as a hearth rate device. It would be great also if it synch with some other common health apps.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ari

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without them!
customer_reviews.text: These have become my go to headphones for entertainment while I'm navigating the city ever since I got them. They are reliable, high quality, and have lots of useful features. The audio pass through mode means you can leave the headphones in while you're talking to people, and the charging case means I've never run out of battery. Seriously, a great pair of Bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Beware - Jabra warranty support is horrible to deal with.
customer_reviews.text: Charging case quit working 1 week after the year warranty ran out. Jabra support gives me the run-around. A quick Google search will show that the charging case is defective. Jabra support's warranty request link that their support team sends does not even work. They acknowledged that they know it doesn't work, then offer no other solutions. I am now stuck with a $220 POS. I should have bought the airpods.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Huntington

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was not great, would not stay connected to my phone(Pixel 3) not sure if it just wasn't compatible. Very disappointed, expected better performance especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Unequal Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay, liked the features, but lasted less than 6 months. The main earbud (right) noticeably lowered in volume compared to the left. The earbuds are set up that you have to use the right side one in order to use the left side one. It technically still worked, but was really weird to listen to music with the right side super quiet and the right side at normal volume.
customer_reviews.author: luna2002

customer_reviews.title: Good sound if you buy other ear cushions that seal in your ear canals
customer_reviews.text: If you get some aftermarket ear cushions that seal in your ear and extend into your ear, these will sound great! The earbud cushions that come with these are worthless! Good product but not sent with cushions that allow for a good seal.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Highest Quality Wireless Headset
customer_reviews.text: I tried B&O and Sony prior to buying these. The case is tiny that they charge in and in 20 min. They are charged for 3 hours. They stay in your ears during burpees, jumping jacks, etc as well. I am still learning to use the audible coaching while running and working out and the Bluetooth to my iPhone 8 is perfect too. They are also waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Pride

customer_reviews.title: Overated and overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Major connection problems. Bluetooth only pairs properly with music and phone. Terribly Uncomfortable after short use. Customer service is a joke, says buds are only designed for phone. Completely unhelpful. If you plan to Try to watch any video, or use with ipad, peloton etc AVOID. Supposedly highly rated but honestly over priced and under serviced. Wasted too much time with customer service and missed the return window- maybe ebay now
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Drexler

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these. They work great for a few months but then they both had the same problem, the right ear bud volume starts to fail so you have normal volume on left and nearly no volume on right. I bought the 2cnd set bc I liked them and thought this was an anomaly, but same thing happened with the second set. Can't get it fixed and Jabra support is no help. Only buy this if you are looking for 2-3 months of use and then frustration!
customer_reviews.author: Kevan D Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work on flights!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product in February, now it is August and I realized it does not work on flights. I called the customer support line and they advised me not to use it on flights as the product was designed to be used for exercise only. Since it is water-resistant it does not work with the change of air pressure. I am stuck with this product that does not fit my needs. I will move to Bose for better sound quality and reliability! Save your money, it is not worth it
customer_reviews.author: LuisGValente

customer_reviews.title: Right Earbud Fails Immediately
customer_reviews.text: This was a BIG purchase for me and I thought I had done my research, not so. The right earbud failed within weeks of owning these. I thought it was user error so I did not return them. However, after reading and rereading the manual and the tech support site for Jabra, I realized that I was using the controls correctly. Then I googled "Jabra Elite Sport can't hear in right earbud" and that is how I found out that this is a common issue for these earbuds. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: Right (main) earbud has lost all volume
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds were fantastic when they worked. After a few weeks, the right earbud lost all volume. I tried the solutions I found documented in various places online (reinstall language, hard reset, etc) but nothing worked. The only way they work now is to use both earbuds but sound only is delivered in the left earbud. Previously I used just the right earbud so I had my other ear available to hear. I will try to exchange them and see how the next pair works.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Prochazka

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds did not stay in; quality was poor
customer_reviews.text: Despite experimenting with seemingly every variation of pieces, I could not get the earbuds to consistently stay in. To make matters worse, the earbuds are round, and when they fall on the ground, they roll away, which is how I lost one of the earbuds. The sounds quality was also significantly worse than anticipated. I would have to manually jam the earbud in my ear beyond the point that it naturally sits in my ear in order to hear many elements of the sound including bass.
customer_reviews.author: Josef Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, the best set of true wireless ear buds! If/when the time comes, I will buy the same set.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the better true wireless devices! I favor these over my Bose true wireless ear buds. They are not bulky. They fit very well and are comfortable while I run, exercise, work in the yard, etc.. great sound, great fit, great product.
customer_reviews.author: jaime hesse

customer_reviews.title: Good luck with your warranty request
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds have "okay" sound quality, but it is difficult to achieve a proper seal and you may have an earbud fall out your ear during an intense workout. I had these for a few months before the right bud stopped making sounds (the buttons still worked though) and was able to get a replacement in a fairly timely manner. However, a few months after getting a replacement the left earbud went out. I have been trying to get this bud replaced for almost a month. Look elsewhere for your new pair of earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Tylor M.

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 2 years. And then the left ear bud was intermittent. And then they both got worse. Honestly, I expected better from such a costly earphone.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the buy if you exercise
customer_reviews.text: The product was great. Two reasons I rated it a four was because it was a little bit bigger than I expected but doable and I had to put my volumn all the way up in order to have a decent volumn to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: Zwei

customer_reviews.title: Died after 13 months
customer_reviews.text: Dislike 1. Died after 13 months, right when the warranty ended. 2. REALLY hard and uncomfortable to push buttons while wearing the headphones 3. Heart rate monitor is only bluetooth, not ANT+, so it doesn't sync with any commonly used sports tech (e.g. I cant use it to display my heart rate on my running watch while I run) Pros: 1. Didn't fall out of my ears while I run.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: They are great sports earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I used the beats2 wireless earbuds and then went to these. They do exactly what they say they do. They stay in my ear while running and doing any type of workout. If you wear them for hours on end they might not be the most comfortable, but is by no means a dealbreaker. the sound quality is good but I’ve seen some complaints on other comments and for me it wasn’t anything that would stop me from buying them again. Battery life is good. I would buy them again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unstable behavior and easily ruined
customer_reviews.text: Although they are certified against water, after 2 months of having the right hearing aid began to decrease its volume in coparacion with the left to the point that the right is no longer heard, the HearThrough option disappointed me because despite having the ear a 80% isolated, does not play very well external sounds, EarGel at least for my ear are very annoying and cause me pain to have them for a long time, the application is quite good, but the headphones not much, are not very good quality
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THESE OR YOU'LL REGRET IT AFER 2 WEEKS
customer_reviews.text: Had an older version it was very good. When i lost one of my buds i bought two of these but these ones deserve a zero star. The left bud sounded very bad they told me to do a firmware update after it was worst. Dont buy these sh*t or ull spend hundreds to enjoy them for 2 weeks. The worst is that i bought one for my GF too. Very disappointed... ZERO STAR.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: whats not to like sounds great no connectivity problems no cutting out long ...
customer_reviews.text: whats not to like sounds great no connectivity problems no cutting out long battery life great job jabra believe me I tried them all they were all sent back either they were not comfortable or cutting out or battery life was poor or the sound was not great. These are just right very happy.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Price vs Investment
customer_reviews.text: Yes these are cheaper than the Bose, but the difference in sound and the difference in build quality when you hold them in your hand, is undeniable. Just get the Soundsport Free's and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable. Sound periodically cuts out in one or the other earbud
customer_reviews.text: At first they were great. But as time went on they became less reliable. One earbud will be at about 25-50% of the volume of the other earbud. So if you are turning the volume up or down they both go up and down the same but one is half the volume of the other. When they work, sound quality is great the fit is great, they work for everything I intended them for. But the problem is they don’t always work. Only a few months old.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, Good Sound, Battery Issues (Less Than 3 Weeks of Use)
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fit of these headphones. While working out, they clip into my ears well and don't move at all. But I received these headphones on Nov. 28th, have used them only during the work week, and now find that the right earbud will only hold enough charge to briefly connect to my phone and then power-off. I don't know if it's an issue with the case or with the earbud. Currently reaching out to Jabra Support for a replacement. But getting less than 3 weeks of normal use out of these is concerning.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Rees

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCTUCT
customer_reviews.text: its a real real good product it works great it fits perfect and the sound it is a whole lot better the beats earbuds. really recommend this earbuds, and it gives your HR it keeps track of every step you take
customer_reviews.author: Mariela

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed really
customer_reviews.text: Had them for three weeks. First the volume went down in left earbud then the problem reversed to the right. Sent them back and waiting for a refund. Last try will be the Elite 65t.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dalloway

customer_reviews.title: Least durable ear buds I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the right fit on your ear buds the sound quality and noise cancellation is wonderful. BUT, after about 45 days my left ear bud started playing noticably quieter than the right one. And now after about 70 days they both sound like they're broken. I use them pretty frequently but I also take exceptional care of them (they live in the case or in my ears). Big disappointment over all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This does not hold up. The ear buds are uncomfortable. It will unexpectedly connect to your device. Eventually, only one ear bud will work. Pass on this. Not worth the money. And you can’t return it.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Fully charged and will not turn on. No lights, no sound, nothing. Waste of time and money. Sent back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MARK

customer_reviews.title: Not at all what we expected
customer_reviews.text: Had a very difficult time getting any combination of ear pads to work. They either wouldn't fit or would hurt trying to get them to fit. These are definitely not made for everyone. The "Hear Through" feature did very little. I still had to take the ear piece out to hear what anyone was saying to me. I would not recommend this to anyone especially considering the lofty price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Full waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This headphone are amazing the only issue was that I can’t connect to two device simultaneously but other than that it’s a great pair
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: Good feautures, horrible sound
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and sturdy but the sound on these is like nails on a chalkboard. I’m not even comparing them to high quality wired Bose headphones. My four year old Beats have a better base and sound than these. I listen to mostly heavy metal and the sound on these is so terrible that’s it’s annoying. The Jaybird Run is a MUCH better sounding wireless headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: One would assume that for that price the headphones would stay connected to the phone during calls, not! You know what happens when you assume right?
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Montelongo

customer_reviews.title: Too many kinks still needing to be worked out
customer_reviews.text: At first, I wasn't thrilled by the fit, but eventually got used to it. I also wasn't thrilled with the audio transparency, and eventually left it turned off. Right out of the box, I had issues with calls cutting out when using them. Then, after a few weeks of use, the left earbud started crackling. Too many issues with these earbuds, so I sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Sound and Functionality
customer_reviews.text: The sound is amazing. I am a big fan of headphones with noise cancellation and didn't think that wireless earbuds would produce a great sound at the same time providing noise cancellation. I use them at work with my laptop for meetings and listening to music. Everyone on my meetings states that my voice is clear, even with cube neighbors talking in the background.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Best True Wireless
customer_reviews.text: Best wireless earbuds I have ever owned. Does not tangle anywhere and sound quality is superb. I wish the bass was better but it I haven't heard wireless earbuds with great bass. Battery life is also great with the carrying case. Go for the 4.5 hour version!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your ears may not be built for this
customer_reviews.text: Be warned: you may be one more of the poor people found that their ears are simply not built for this particular pair of earbuds. Gifted them to a friend who is now exuberant: she loves them, they are indeed waterproof, you can shower in them. She also says the noise cancelling is very good, but inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Norayr

customer_reviews.title: These are great for running (especially with Apple Watch)
customer_reviews.text: These are great for running (especially with Apple Watch), but don’t buy them to use with a Peloton spin bike. The audio/video lag will drive you nuts! The Peloton uses ANT+ for heart rate monitoring so you wouldn’t be able to use the Bluetooth HR monitor in these anyway.
customer_reviews.author: mfink

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting! Paid for NEW and received USED!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am disgusted by what I received! I paid for NEW earbuds and what I got in the mail was far from that!!!!! The packaging for the ear tips seemed handled, but my excitement for the product dismissed my worry. When I peeled back the protective film it released with ease to show tons of fingerprints, lint, possibly dog hair, and questionable gunk I hope wasn’t ear wax. I opened the package with the wingtips and found the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda T

customer_reviews.title: My Father's pair did as well poor quality control it seems like these devices are dying ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones stopped working not too long after I got them. My Father's pair did as well poor quality control it seems like these devices are dying too much. Used to be a big supporter of jabra as i have had a few headsets but sadly I probably won't purchase anything else from them.
customer_reviews.author: John Endrihs

customer_reviews.title: Left ear bud stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to warnings regarding the quality of these headphones. Numerous cases where the left headphone piece stopped working. Inevitably, that's what I experience with less than 4 months of usage. Audio plays out of the right headphone piece clearly, however, the left headphone piece has the faintest sound come out of it. Given the price, this was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Calabro

customer_reviews.title: Gel tips push themselves out of my ear canal: Doesn't stay in my ears.
customer_reviews.text: 9/15/18 So far good sound quality but gel tips push themselves out of my ear canal and can't get a good fit, ordering the $16 memory foam variety pack bundle from Comply to see it that works. Does not fit and stay in my ears otherwise. Not sure how you "tuck" the gel wing under your ear cartilage to have it stay in your ear as for me that adds to it pushing itself out of my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: lasted lest than a year
customer_reviews.text: Soft cover where the buttons are engraved pealed off, left earbud stopped making any sound but Bluetooth and lights kept working. Still, during the time I they worked I liked them so much that I got a new pair, lowering my expectations of durability.
customer_reviews.author: Absol

customer_reviews.title: ... on to fit in your ear these are a great fit and very rarely fall out even when doing ...
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the right nubs on to fit in your ear these are a great fit and very rarely fall out even when doing exercise such as boxing, kickboxing. Sound may sound a little flat at times but other than that these are a great addition to my headphone collection.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Hockly

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good connection, drops are rare and few in between. Once fitted, these won't fall out. These will give pretty good bass with the correct fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Craig W

product_meta.title: Jabra Elite Sport Earbuds – Waterproof Fitness & Running Earbuds with Heart Rate and Activity Tracker, True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds with Superior Sound, Advanced Connectivity and Charging Case
product_meta.description: Jabra Elite Sport wireless earbuds feature superior sound quality for music and calls, and advanced wireless connectivity to ensure true performance. Our intuitive true wireless earbud design includes two microphones in each bud that work together to filter our background noise, ensuring that only your voice is heard clearly and with no distraction – in every environment. Whether you’re a seasoned athlete or just trying to get fit, you can train smarter, not harder, with Jabra Elite Sport earbuds and our integrated fitness app, Jabra Sport Life. The in-ear precision heart rate monitor works with the app to track and analyze your fitness as well as provide personalized audio coaching in real-time during your workout. Monitor absolute fitness, have reps counted automatically, predict race pace, and more. Enjoy custom-fitting workout earbuds thanks to the 3 sizes of EarGels and foam tips that are included, giving you the right fit to boost music and call quality. Plus, 3 sizes of EarWings further enhance comfort and heart rate sensor. With just the touch of a button, you can be more aware of your surrounding with hear through, which conveniently filters out the sounds around you. Whether you’re jogging or working out at the gym, these cordless earbuds stay snugly in your ears while you’re in motion – ensuring you won’t miss a beat. Jabra Elite Sport are waterproof wireless earbuds that offer guaranteed durability. They have an IP67-rated waterproof design with a 3-year warranty against sweat damage (registration required via Jabra Sport Life App. Microphone Sensitivity: 38 dBV/Pa.
feature_bullets: True wireless earbuds – Jabra Elite Sport earbuds offer superior sound for calls and music and advance wireless connectivity to ensure true performance. Two microphones in each earbud work together to filter our background noise and ensure clarity.

Secure custom fit – Enjoy custom-fitting workout earbuds thanks to the 3 sizes of EarGels and foam tips included to give you the right fit that boosts music and call quality. Plus, 3 sizes of EarWings further enhance comfort and heart rate sensor.
All-day power – Now with a battery that delivers 4.5 hours of play time coupled with a portable charging case, these Jabra wireless in-ear headphones give you 13.5 hours of power to keep you going.

Sports earbuds – The in-ear precision heart rate monitor works with our integrated Jabra Sport Life app to track/analyze your fitness. Monitor absolute fitness level, have reps counted automatically, predict race pace and more. For all experience levels.

Waterproof design – Jabra Elite Sport are waterproof earbuds that offer guaranteed durability. They have an IP67-rated waterproof design with a 3-year warranty against sweat damage (registration required via Jabra Sport Life App).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars813 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Earbuds, Eargels, Earwings, Charging Case, USB Charging Cable, Quick Start Guide
specifications.Department: Cell Phones & Accessories > Cell Phone Accessories > Bluetooth Headsets
